text: Hi, Does anyone know if I can get all the deals under each dealstage

Hi all,
I have a query. Is HubSpot activity updated in real-time?
I am using API `<https://api.hubapi.com/engagements/v1/engagements>`
but HubSpot activity is not updating in real-time. I have to switch the tab to see the new feed. (edited)

I wrote a helper method that uses batch functions that I use all the time for this.  It's way too long to show here but basically the method signature looks like
```static async getAssociatedObjects(req, res, next, data, fromObjectType, toObjectType)```
and I send it the data I want to use that has all the ID values - so your deal IDs for example - and I send along the associations I want in the fromObjectType and toObjectType (deal and company for your example) then in the method I set up a call to batch read the associations.  The method then extracts those associated IDs returned and makes another call to batch read the actual object data (I have a switch statement in there so I can select the appropriate type (deal, company, contact, line item, etc) - then I return all the actual data to the caller.  It was a lot of work to set up but the reusability is definitely worth the effort.

Hi everyone,

I hope this message finds you well. We are seeking assistance with an issue that has arisen following our transition from using Hapikey (v2 version) to a Private App (v3 version) for our API calls. Since making this change, we have encountered a problem with tracking Google and Facebook leads in our HubSpot contacts list.

Previously, when we used a [specific code], tracking for contacts originating from Google functioned correctly for v2 version. However, after switching to v3 version, the tracking no longer seems to differentiate properly between Google and Facebook leads. Instead, [specific code] appears to aggregate contacts from both sources under a single filter in the HubSpot contacts list, particularly under the "Original source drill-down 2" filter option.

Could you please help us resolve this issue so that we can correctly track and differentiate leads coming from Google and Facebook separately as we did before?

Thank you in advance for your help and support.
Hi <@U05H3C4GDMX> , do you know where I could find the answers to these questions / who I should talk to? :blush: That is going to impact the way we conceive our integration

Hi all - does HS has an endpoint to *actually* archive an object instead of delete an object?

in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects|HS doc>, there is a section for archive, but it actually remove the object (move to
my goal is just to archive an object, so that it still visible in the HS table but get a remark of `archive=true`

thank you

Hey! Curious if activities are created through the API on a contact or company record will they follow the HubSpot default association patterns (_and associate to the open deal_).

Or  is the association pattern controlled within that API call / integration?
Does anyone know why HubSpot changed my closedate's value from ""2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z" to ""2023-12-31T00:00:00.000Z" when I posted my json message to "crm/v3/objects/deals"?
Hi
Hi Moiz

I joined the community as I was being directed from the HubSpot chat support, here too. I am getting an API key error while integrating HubSpot with Brevo. Error image attached for review. If anyone could please help me out, it will be highly appreciated.
Hello Long
Could you please let me know what exactly might be the issue. I have input the correct API key still I am getting this error.
You can use the search endpoint to search for deals in a specific deal stage
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals>
search is the last one on this page
I would log `config.clientId` to the console and make sure it's defined and the proper value, hard to say without looking at the rest of the code / config object etc.
Are you putting in a Brevo key or HubSpot Private App Token?

Hi all, has anyone found a way to filter tasks by their queue? I can't find anything in the documentation that supports this. I am trying to return a bunch of tasks based on their queue ids (or open to suggestions on a better way).

What does the propertyHistory look like for the closedate on the affected Deal?

If it is just presented as a date that is offset by 1 day on the UI, then it would be something to do with the Timezone configuration for your HubSpot portal. Relevant thread: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/What-timezone-is-my-closedate/m-p/299691>
